page.title: 13BUILDINGS IN DUNURE (1)
page.content: The centre of original village of Dunure is an artificial harbour blasted out of solid rock in 1811 costing Â£50,000.Was little used for intended purpose of exporting coal but used until recently for local fishing fleet.Boats now too large to use harbour which is summer anchorage for about 40 small craft.The harbour and remains of stone lighthouse at entrance are "B" Grade Listed Buildings.Much of original settlement remains in 2 streets.Harbour view row of vernacular buildings sloping steeply to harbour.One storey at top increasing to two storey at bottom but retaining constant roof line.At right angles runs Sea View a continuous row of slightly later single storey cottages facing the sea.Houses all built in early 19th Century.
